The following are video lectures that I use in my introductory statistics courses at Tarleton State University.  Please do not copy and/or distribute without proper attribution.

- Unit 1: Introduction to using statistics in psychology ([video](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ubSNDnXJ8LM))
- Unit 2: Central tendency, standard deviation, and $z$-scores ([video](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fjGLPb-rHDI))
- Unit 3: Correlation ([video](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UTaSuZqWHc0))
- Unit 4: Probability and the normal distribution ([video](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8yhDJeRaTM4))
- Unit 5: Hypothesis testing ([video](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6ctHbOF0_Us))
- Unit 6: Tests on sample means / Effect sizes and power ([video](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ib3YEZj7T08))
- Unit 7: Introduction to the $t$-test ([video](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XpLJzU0T8y8))
- Unit 8: The independent samples $t$-test ([video](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=14_x9rLO2oA))
- Unit 9: Analysis of variance for one independent variable ([video](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dZq-rpsGXzY))
- Unit 10: Analysis of variance for two independent variables ([video](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wICeVTG8rGk))
